uk.ac.aber.dcs.cs124.clg11.diag

Class ClassDiag

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.aber.dcs.cs124.clg11.diag.Drawable
      • uk.ac.aber.dcs.cs124.clg11.diag.ClassDiag

  • public class ClassDiag
extends Drawable
    GUI layer used to output/draw a particular class created by a user to the CanvasPanel. Retrieves data about class from ClassDiagData object. Stored of type 'ClassDiag' in VectorOfDrawables
    Author:
    Connor Goddard (clg11), Sam Jackson (???), Craig Hepinsthall (???)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClassDiag

        public ClassDiag()

      • ClassDiag

        public ClassDiag(double x,
         double y,
         int varNo,
         int opNo)
        Sets local variables required to draw class diagram. Calculates height and width using number of variables/methods and maximum length of class entries.
        Parameters:
        x - - X coordinate of mouse position when clicked (i.e. X coord. of new ClassDiag)
        y - - Y coordinate of mouse position when clicked (i.e. Y coord. of new ClassDiag)
        varNo - - Number of variables entered by user
        opNo - - Number of methods entered by user

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Calculates the width of class diagram by determining maximum length of any class variables/methods entered, before drawing complete diagram, including class data (retrieved from ClassDiagData) to CanvasPanel.
        Specified by:
        paint in class Drawable
        See Also:
        Drawable.paint(java.awt.Graphics)

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns:
        width - Width of class diagram calculated from longest string length

      • update

        public void update(int X,
          int Y)
        Updates the X/Y position of the class diagram after user has completed moving the diagram by dragging across the CanvasPanel
        Parameters:
        X - - X coordinate of mouse position after dragging (i.e. new X position coordinate for class diagram)
        Y - - Y coordinate of mouse position after dragging (i.e. new Y position coordinate for class diagram)

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns:
        height - Height of class diagram calculated by number of variables/method in class

      • getOffset

        public int getOffset()
        Returns:
        offset - Equal 'Y' distance between each of the variables/methods to allow correct drawing

      • setOffset

        public void setOffset(int offset)
        Parameters:
        offset - - Increment of 'offset' to allow equal 'Y' spacing as class diagram is drawn downwards

      • getVarNo

        public int getVarNo()
        Returns:
        varNo - Number of variables entered by the user in the class

      • setVarNo

        public void setVarNo(int varNo)
        Parameters:
        varNo - - Sets the number of variables entered by the user in the class

      • getOpNo

        public int getOpNo()
        Returns:
        opNo - Number of operations/methods entered by the user in the class

      • setOpNo

        public void setOpNo(int opNo)
        Parameters:
        opNo - - Sets the number of operations/methods entered by the user in the class

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(int height)
        Parameters:
        height - - Sets height of class diagram calculated by number of variables/method in class

      • setBackColour

        public void setBackColour(java.awt.Color backColour)
        Parameters:
        backColour - - Colour of class diagram background chosen by user using JColorChooser

      • setTextColour

        public void setTextColour(java.awt.Color textColour)
        Parameters:
